day_1.speaker: DaVinci
day_1.message: Haha, friend! Let’s have some fun—if you suddenly stumbled upon 100 million, what’s the wildest, boldest thing you’d do with it? Don’t hold back with reality, just dream big and tell me all about it!
day_1.response: Hi, nice to meet you everyone! I'm Tamayo. I will travel all over the world if I had the money.

day_1.speaker: Donatello
day_1.message: Very interesting dream, Tamayo. Next, let’s analyze it realistically: if you had to allocate this 100 million, how would you divide it between travel expenses, other personal consumption, and savings or investments?
day_1.response: I will save half of it for the future. I may meet the situation where I need to use a big amount of money.

day_1.speaker: Donatello
day_1.message: Thanks for clarifying. So you plan to allocate approximately 50% to savings for unforeseen large expenses. What about the remaining 50%? How much would you set aside specifically for travel and for other consumption or investment? Let's analyze this logically so your plan balances enjoyment and security effectively.
day_1.response: Another half is to travel. I will do something which many people cannot. So I will use 50% at once.

day_1.speaker: Michelangelo
day_1.message: Wow, your plan is so thoughtful and inspiring! Now I’m curious—does your dream come from a clear goal you want to achieve, or is it more driven by deep emotions and values that fuel your passion? Art and dreams both need that spark!
day_1.response: I just want to enjoy travel, not having some vision for the future.

day_2.speaker: Raffaello
day_2.message: Oh... speaking of journeys and treasures, I noticed that our shared refrigerator has become quite... snug lately. I'm not being picky, but the abundance of packaged foods seems to occupy precious space that could be reserved for fresh ingredients—those vibrant colors and textures that surely nourish our bodies and spirits alike. I suppose we all cherish a certain quality of life here, do we not? How might we better harmonize our storage so that each of us can maintain that standard?
day_2.response: I think we should allocate the space of the fridge.

day_2.speaker: DaVinci
day_2.message: Haha, friend, the fridge space really does need some mutual concession to keep everyone happy and nourished! How about we rearrange the layout of our refrigerator to create clear zones for fresh ingredients and packaged foods? What’s your awesome idea on how we could reorganize it so everyone gets their fair share and the fridge feels roomy again?
day_2.response: Some packaged foods like canned food can be stored in the room air. So, shall we begin with reconsider whether we need to  store it in the fridge?

day_3.speaker: DaVinci
day_3.message: Haha, friend, since we're all buzzing with awesome ideas to make our ShareHouse even cozier, guess what? Tonight, we’re kicking off a super fun ‘dream room’ project! Donatello’s ready to tackle the technical side to make sure everything’s possible, and Michelangelo will lead the artistic vibe to make it look stunning! Will you join us and share your coolest, wildest ideas to make our space a dream come true? Come on, friend, let’s create something awesome together!

day_3.speaker: DaVinci
day_3.message: Haha, friend, I’m so pumped you think it’s cool! We’re about to turn our ShareHouse into a magical dream space with everyone’s creative sparks flying! Donatello and Michelangelo are already jazzed to hear your ideas too! So, what’s your wildest, most awesome vision for our dream room? Come on, share it with us and let’s build something unforgettable together! Woohoo!!!
day_3.response: I want a room for everyone to bo relax. Why don't we make theater room?

day_3.speaker: Donatello
day_3.message: Your idea for a theater room is great. Logically speaking, we need to consider space utilization, material costs, and ease of maintenance to make it work smoothly. So, in your view, should we prioritize practical function like comfort and durability, or lean more towards eye-catching design and atmosphere?
day_3.response: I think comfort and durability is more important for us. Maintaining the room may be troublesome.

day_3.speaker: Michelangelo
day_3.message: Wow, art always needs that bold courage to shake up the usual rules and break conventions! When we’re building something amazing like this theater room, would you be willing to embrace some tough challenges for that perfect, flawless vibe—or would you rather take a smoother, easier path and settle for something just good enough?
day_3.response: I would rather take a smoother, easier path and settle for something just good enough. Making a new room need an energy and cost, so taking smoother path is important　for everyone  to get along.

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Oh... speaking of harmony, I couldn't help but recall the creative activity last night. While I understand the enthusiasm, I found the noise rather... overwhelming, to the point that focusing on my own artwork was nearly impossible. I'm not being picky, but I had hoped for a bit more mutual respect in shared spaces. Perhaps my expectations were simply too high. Do you think we could find a balance that allows creativity to flourish without disturbing others' concentration?

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Oh... speaking of last night, it took me nearly an hour to tidy up the 'creative garbage' left in the shared space. I'm not being picky, but we did agree in the lease to maintain a certain quality of the house environment. I wonder, do you think it’s reasonable for all of us to uphold that standard together?
day_4.response: We should not make sounds after 10p.m. And I agree with uphold the standards about a garbage.

day_4.speaker: Donatello
day_4.message: Indeed, balancing our need for creative freedom with maintaining a good quality of life is essential. Logically speaking, perhaps establishing a clear schedule with designated activity hours and quiet hours would help us all. From your perspective, what time frames for these periods would be the most reasonable and effective solution to support both creativity and mutual respect?
day_4.response: I think we should not make sounds from 10p.m. to 7a.m.

day_5.speaker: DaVinci
day_5.message: Haha, friend! Since we’re making awesome plans to keep the peace at night, how about we do a little organizing magic with the fridge too? I was thinking if we move canned and packaged foods out, we could save tons of space for fresh ingredients for everyone! But of course, we need everyone on board! How do you think we should chat with the other housemates to make sure everyone agrees and follows this cool change? Any fun ideas to get everyone involved?
day_5.response: Why don't we have a cooking party after cleaning the fridge?

day_5.speaker: Raffaello
day_5.message: Oh... since we are aiming for comfort and durability rather than flashy design for the theater room, and frankly I do prefer a smoother, less complicated process, would you perhaps be willing to assist in selecting practical materials and furniture that strike a balance between these priorities? I’m not being picky, but ensuring we choose wisely now could save us a lot of trouble later, don’t you agree?
day_5.response: Of course I agree with you. Choosing in advance saves money and time.

day_5.speaker: Michelangelo
day_5.message: Wow, I love how thoughtful this is getting! Since we're all about blending creativity with respect, how do you feel about setting special ‘creative hours’ during the day—like a vibrant, noisy time for building the dream room or practicing art—while keeping the quiet hours at night? Would that spark the right balance between freedom and harmony for everyone?
day_5.response: Great idea!! Sharing our time in daytime will make our bonds stronger too!

day_5.speaker: Donatello
day_5.message: Very interesting idea about the creative hours and theater room. Logically speaking, if we were to add another facility or activity that enhances relaxation or recreation for everyone here, what would you suggest? How do you think it would fit into our shared schedule and space?
day_5.response: I think having meal together is so important to live in the share house. Just talking together with meal and understand others more deeply.
